Configuring Quality of Service Policy

A quality of service (QoS) policy assigns a system class to the outgoing traffic for a vNIC or vHBA. This system class determines the quality of service for that traffic. For certain adapters you can also specify additional controls on the outgoing traffic, such as burst and rate.

You must include a QoS policy in a vNIC policy or vHBA policy and then include that policy in a service profile to configure the vNIC or vHBA.

 1. In the QoS Policy screen, enter a name for Quality of Service policy in the Name field.

Figure 5-5 Quality of Service Policy

 2. From the Organization drop-down list, select the required organization for which you wish to configure the QoS policy.

 3. From the Priority drop-down list, select any of the following values depending upon the vHBA/NIC traffic.

 • FC

 • Platinum

 • Gold

 • Silver

 • Bronze

 • Best Effort

 

 4. In the Burst (bytes) drop-down list, the default value displayed is 10240. The default values indicates the traffic burst size to apply this policy for servers. You can set values between 0 to 65535.

 5. In the Rate (kbps) drop-down list, the default value is line-rate. This implies that the line-rate value denotes zero, and there is no rate-limit. The minimum value is 8, and maximum value is 40,000,000.

 6. From the Host drop-down list, select the host permission. The values are None and Full.

 7. Click Add to configure the QoS Policy.

The derived QoS policy information is displayed in the text area.

 8. Click Save and Next to proceed further.
